concept.title: Resolved issues
concept.shortdesc:
Security and bug fixes in the
1.x release series.

section.title: The wait_until_available function returned incorrect results using orchestrator (1.23.0)
section.p: When using the PCP transport, the plan function wait_until_available now returns error results only for targets that can't be reached. (BOLT-1382)

section.title: tasks on localhost didn't use correct default PS_ARGS (1.23.0)
section.p: scripts and tasks run over the local transport on hosts no longer load profiles and are run with the Bypass execution policy to maintain parity with the WinRM transport. (BOLT-1358)

section.title: Inventory was loaded for commands that didn't use it (1.20.0)
section.p: Inventory was loaded even for commands that don't use targets, such as bolt task show. An error in the inventory could subsequently cause the command to fail. (BOLT-1268)

section.title: YAML plan converter wrapped single-line evaluation steps (1.20.0)
section.p: The bolt plan convert command wrapped single-line evaluation steps in a with() statement unnecessarily. (BOLT-1299)

section.title: File upload stalled with local transport using run-as (1.18.0)
section.p: The bolt file upload command stalled when using local the local transport if the destination file existed. (BOLT-1262)

section.title: Rerun file wasn't generated without an existing project directory (1.18.0)
section.p: If no project directory existed, a .rerun.json file wasn't created, preventing you from rerunning failed commands. now creates a default project directory when one doesn't exist so that .rerun.json files are generated as expected. (BOLT-1263)

section.title: SELinux management didn't work on localhost (1.17.0)
section.p: now ships with components similar to the agent to avoid discrepancies between using a puppet-agent to apply code locally versus using the puppet-agent. (BOLT-1244)

section.title: implementation of the service and package tasks returned incorrect results (1.16.0)
section.p: The and bash implementations for the service and package tasks are more robust and provide output more consistent with the implementation. (BOLT-1103, BOLT-1104)

section.title: Remote tasks could run on non-remote targets (1.15.0)
section.p: Remote tasks can now be run only on remote targets (BOLT-1203)

section.title: known_hosts weren't parsed correctly (1.15.0)
section.p: Previously, when a valid hostname entry was present in known_hosts and the host-key-check SSH configuration option was set, host key validation could fail when a valid IP address was not included in the known_hosts entry. This behavior was inconsistent with system SSH where the IP address is not required. Host key checking has been updated to match system SSH. (BOLT-495)

section.title: Plan variables were visible to sub-plans (1.15.0)
section.p: Variables defined in scope in a plan were visible to sub-plans called with run_plan. (BOLT-1190)

section.title: The _run_as option was clobbered by configuration (1.13.1)
section.p: The run-as configuration option took precedence over the _run_as parameter when calling run_* functions in a plan. The _run_as parameter now has a higher priority than config or CLI. (BOLT-1050)

section.title: Tasks with certain configuration options failed when using stdin (1.13.1)
section.p: When both interpreters and run-as were configured, tasks that required parameters to be passed over stdin failed. (BOLT-1155)

section.title: task helper symbolized only top-level parameter keys (1.13.0)
section.p: Previously the ruby_task_helperTaskHelper.run method symbolized only-top level parameter keys. Now nested keys are also symbolized. (BOLT-1053)

section.title:
String segments in commands had to be triple-quoted in
(1.12.0)
section.p:
When running
in
with commands to be run on
nodes, string segments that could be interpreted by
needed to be triple-quoted. (BOLT-159)

section.title: Unsecured download of the puppet_agent::install task (1.11.0)
section.p: The bash implementation of the puppet_agent::install task now downloads packages over HTTPS instead of HTTP. This fix ensures the download is authenticated and secures against a man-in-the-middle attack.

section.title: Unsecured download of the puppet_agent::install_powershell task (1.10.0)
section.p:
The PowerShell implementation of the puppet_agent::install task now downloads
.msi files using HTTPS instead of HTTP. This fix ensures the download is authenticated and secures against a man-in-the-middle attack.

conbody.section:
crashed if
configuration was invalid (1.9.0) If an invalid puppetdb.conf file is detected,
now issues a warning instead of crashing (BOLT-756)

section.title: Local transport returned incorrect exit status (1.9.0)
section.p: Local transport now correctly returns an exit code instead of the stat of the process status as an integer. (BOLT-1074)

section.title: Standard library functions weren't packaged in 1.8.0 (1.8.1)
section.p: Version 1.8.0 didn't include new standard library functions as intended. This release now includes standard library functions in the gem and packages. (BOLT-1065)

section.title:
puppet_agent::install task didn't match on
(1.8.0)
section.p:
The puppet_agent::install task now uses updates in the facts task to resolve
operating system facts and to download the correct puppet-agent package. (BOLT-997)

section.title: Select module content missing from puppet-bolt package (1.7.0)
section.p: Previous releases of the puppet-bolt package omitted the python_task_helper and ruby_task_helper modules. These are now included. (BOLT-1036)

section.title: wait_until_available function didn't work with Docker transport (1.6.0)
section.p: We merged the Docker transport and wait_until_available function in the same release, and they didn't play nicely together. (BOLT-1018)

section.title: Python task helper didn't generate appropriate errors (1.6.0)
section.p:
The Python task helper included with
didn't produce an error if an exception was thrown in a task implemented with the helper. (BOLT-1021)

section.title:
Plans with no return value weren't marked complete in
(1.3.0)
section.p:
now correctly reports plan completion to
for plans that don't return a value. Previously, a plan that didn't return a value incorrectly logged that the plan didn't complete. (BOLT-959)

section.title: Some functions weren't available in the BoltSpec::Plans library (1.3.0)
section.p: The BoltSpec::Plans library now supports plans that use without_default_logging and wait_until_available, and includes a setup helper that ensures tasks are found and that notice works. (BOLT-971)

section.title: Task implementation not located relative to other files in installdir (1.2.0)
section.p: When you use tasks that include shared code, the task executable is located alongside shared code at _installdir/MODULE/tasks/TASK. (BOLT-931)

section.title: Error when puppet_agent task not run as root (1.1.0)
section.p: The puppet_agent task now checks that it is run as root. When run as another user, it prints and fails with a helpful message. (BOLT-878)

section.title: suppresses errors from transport (1.1.0)
section.p:
Previously,
suppressed some exception errors thrown by transports. For example, when the ed25519 gem was not present for an Net::SSH process, the NotImplementedError for ed25519 keys would not appear. These errors are now identified and displayed. (BOLT-922)

section.title: Loading bolt/executor is "breaking" gettext setup in spec tests (1.0.0)
section.p:
When
is used as a library, it no longer loads code from r10k unless you explicitly require 'bolt/cli'.(BOLT-914)

section.title: Deprecated functions in stdlib result in Evaluation Error (1.0.0)
section.p:
Manifest blocks will now allow use of deprecated functions from stdlib, and language features governed by the 'strict' setting in
. (BOLT-900)

section.title: apply does not provide clientcert fact (1.0.0)
section.p: apply_prep has been updated to collect agent facts as listed in Puppet agent facts. (BOLT-898)

section.title: C:\Program Files\Puppet Labs\Bolt\bin\bolt.bat is non-functional (1.0.0)
section.p:
When moving to
2.5, the .bat scripts in
packaging reverted to hard-coded paths that were not accurate. As a result
would be unusable outside of PowerShell. The .bat scripts have been fixed so they work from cmd.exe as well. (BOLT-886)
